Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a POP3 client connection class in Java that handles socket communication with a POP3 server, including connection establishment, data transmission, and resource cleanup.

Class Description: The Pop3Connection class provides functionality to connect to a POP3 server using TCP sockets, send and receive data through input/output streams, and manage the connection lifecycle.

Attributes:
- socket: Socket - The TCP socket used for communication with the server
- in: BufferedInputStream - Input stream for reading data from the server
- out: BufferedOutputStream - Output stream for writing data to the server

Methods:
- connect() -> Socket - Establishes a connection to the POP3 server by trying all available IP addresses for the host
- connectToAddress(InetAddress address) -> Socket - Creates and connects a socket to a specific server address
- open() -> void - Opens the connection by initializing socket and streams, throws MessagingException on failure
- isOpen() -> boolean - Checks if the connection is currently active and valid
- close() -> void - Closes all connection resources (socket and streams)
- writeLine(String s) -> void - Writes a line of text to the server (appends CRLF)
- readLine() -> String - Reads a line of text from the server (handles CRLF line endings)
